Job DetailsLevelExperiencedJob LocationBuffalo, NY - Buffalo, NYRemote TypeFully RemoteDescriptionAre you passionate about the latest technology trends in machine learning, cloud computing, and data engineering? Are you curious about data and its use to drive decision making? Have you led highly technical and accomplished teams that thrive in developing and delivering innovative software products?E Source has built and is rapidly growing a world class team of Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Machine Learning Engineers to deliver next-generation solutions to help utilities shape the future of sustainable energy. Our team is looking for its next like-minded leader to work alongside a talented team in solving the most challenging problems that energy utilities face. This is a highly technical role providing the opportunity for a blend of team management and hands-on work.What You’ll Do Manage a small but mighty team of 5-10 Machine Learning and Data Engineers in an agile delivery model
Collaborate with Data Scientists and Software Engineers to productize and scale machine learning algorithms on distributed computing platforms like AWS SageMaker and Spark
Collaborate with client solutions teams to architect data engineering pipelines for a variety of data sources (outage management systems, work management systems, advanced smart meters, satellite imagery, grid assets, and weather using frameworks like Dagster and Databricks)
Work alongside leadership to shape and continuously modernize Machine Learning practices and technology frameworks What Will Make You a Good Fit 7+ years of experience in an existing machine learning engineering technical project, product, or team leadership role
Advanced level of Python proficiency to participate in code reviews and pull requests for the team
Advanced level of proficiency with scientific programming packages such as NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, and PySpark
Advanced level of Databricks proficiency to support the development of client data architectures built on Delta Lake
Advanced level of proficiency with GIT version control
Advanced level of proficiency with agile work management in Jira
Experience with reading and translating R code, AWS, and Docker is beneficial A Little About E SourceSince 1986, E Source has focused on partnering with utilities to help their customers save electricity. That novel approach defined the art of electric end-use efficiency—better known as energy efficiency. We’ve expanded that concept to include a broader perspective of sustainability for utilities that deliver electricity, natural gas, and water.We work to enhance relationships with the people utilities serve, achieve the next generation of savings, and lead the carbon-reduction effort. We help utilities think differently, make data useful, and learn from the best strategies across the industry. Our people, our insights, and our network help our clients and give them the assurance that the programs they implement are the most effective.Benefits We offer excellent insurance packages, including medical, dental, and vision plans; company-paid life insurance; company-paid long- and short-term disability insurance; and medical and dependent-care flexible spending plans.
We provide a flexible time off (FTO) program; E Source employees can take as many paid days off per year as they need, with manager approval, while fulfilling their work obligations and ensuring proper coverage of their responsibilities.
We offer flexible schedules, flexible work locations, and a paid parental leave benefit.
We provide a 401(k) plan with a 3% employer match. The budgeted salary for this position is $150,000 to $175,000 + growth and performance-based incentives. Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience.This person can work remote, a hybrid schedule, or from one of our physical office locations.Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US/Canada. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas or Labor Market Impact Assessments (Cdn) at this time.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
